page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO DUDLEY
page.content: Dudley is situated in the{West {Midlands}connurbation. It is part of the{"Black Country"}a name which once reflected the area, because of the coal, iron and steel industries which predominated. Today, Dudley is a busy town dominated by the{castle and {zoological gardens. The people of Dudley take an active interest in Black Country traditions, which are perpetuated by such events as Black Country markets and Black Country evenings.{The Black Country {Museum}is a popular venue. The present day amenities and lifestyles of the inhabitants of Dudley have been fully explored with the help of the following schools:Kates Hill,Sledmere,Highgate and St Josephs Primary schools;Jessons C.E. Middle School and Hillcrest Secondary School.
